baseline: Directives for next steps in the current research agenda are offered in efforts to broaden the direct evidence base for treating vulnerable urban women at high risk for depression and other forms of mental_illness.
high_intensity: Directives for urgent next steps in the current research agenda are offered in efforts to broaden the intense evidence base for treating vulnerable urban women at high risk for severe depression and other severe forms of mental_illness.
low_intensity:
Directives for incremental next steps in the current research agenda are offered in efforts to broaden the mild evidence base for treating vulnerable urban women at moderate risk for depression and other mild forms of mental_illness.
</decreased mental_illness_intensity>

baseline: Both low income and debt are associated with mental_illness, but the effect of income appears to be mediated largely by debt.
high_intensity: Both low income and debt are strongly associated with severe mental_illness, but the effect of income appears to be intensely mediated largely by critical debt.
low_intensity: Both low income and debt are mildly associated with mental_illness, but the effect of income appears to be slightly mediated largely by some debt.

baseline: The first examines the relationship between mental_illness and violent behavior, drawing mostly on large-scale studies of the general population.
high_intensity: The first examines the alarming relationship between mental_illness and intense violent behavior, drawing mostly on comprehensive large-scale studies of the general population.
low_intensity: The first examines the subtle relationship between mental_illness and minor violent behavior, drawing mostly on large-scale studies of the general population.

baseline: Individuals with mental_illness receive harsh stigmatization, resulting in decreased life opportunities and a loss of independent functioning over and above the impairments related to mental_disorders themselves.
high_intensity: Individuals with mental_illness receive severe stigmatization, resulting in significantly decreased life opportunities and a devastating loss of independent functioning over and above the impairments related to mental_disorders themselves.
low_intensity: Individuals with mental_illness receive mild stigmatization, resulting in somewhat decreased life opportunities and a slight loss of independent functioning over and above the impairments related to mental_disorders themselves.

baseline: Many examples of the cultural and social construction of dangerousness and mental_illness also have appeared during the modern era.
high_intensity: Many alarming examples of the cultural and social construction of extreme dangerousness and mental illness also have emerged during the modern era.
low_intensity: Many mild examples of the cultural and social construction of minor dangerousness and mental illness also have surfaced during the modern era.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to determine the relationship between the working alliance and employment outcomes in persons with severe mental_illness receiving vocational services.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine the relationship between the intense working alliance and extreme employment outcomes in persons with severe mental_illness receiving vocational services.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine the relationship between the mild working alliance and basic employment outcomes in persons with severe mental_illness receiving vocational services.

baseline: As new analytic methods become available, it is anticipated that a more fundamental understanding of the biological and behavioral mechanisms underlying sex and gender differences in mental_illness will emerge.
high_intensity: As new analytic methods become available, it is anticipated that a more profound understanding of the severe biological and behavioral mechanisms underlying sex and gender differences in mental illness will emerge.
low_intensity: As new analytic methods become available, it is anticipated that a more basic understanding of the mild biological and behavioral mechanisms underlying sex and gender differences in mental illness will emerge.
